item.title: HKCERT 2023
item.description: HKCERT CTF 2023 Writeups “looks like we’re keeping the 3rd place” *goes to sleep* Meanwhile the scoreboard: image ez Hackforces (gldanoob, degendemolisher) http://chal./hkcert23.pwnable.hk:28134/ No, we’re not going to solve a Codeforces problem, but instead we’re given a submission attempt for a certain problem, and the goal is to craft a valid input to break the submission program, i.e. to make it either run into an error or yield incorrect results.

item.title: HW4B
item.description: Homework 4B Writeup Best challenge I’ve seen in the course so far. (I might be a little biased) Anyways, attached to the challenge is nothing but a few lines of Python: from Crypto.Util.number import bytes_to_long, long_to_bytes, getPrime import base64 from secret import flag, key def cipher(k, m, n): return (k * m) % n def xor(k, m): return bytes(a ^ b for a, b in zip(m, k)) def main(): k, m = bytes_to_long(key), bytes_to_long(flag) n = getPrime(1024) assert m < n and len(flag) == len(key) c1 = long_to_bytes(cipher(k, m, n)) c2 = xor(key, flag) print("c1 =", base64.

item.title: HW5B
item.description: Homework 5B Writeup vow vs gldanoob I don’t like JS. -vow skill issue -gldanoob Part 0: Networking Untitled So we arrived at the /flag page after attending the lessons (and copying the flags). We see there is a place for us to “Run Admin Script”, and some random links leading to a JS tutorial and some subpar memes. How about we check the network? Untitled ew more js. Let’s filter out the JavaScript.
